quotes.quote: A day can really slip by when you're deliberately avoiding what you're supposed to do.
Pain in this life is not avoidable, but the pain we create avoiding pain is avoidable.
There is no avoidance in delay.
It’s not avoidance if you actively plan to pursue it. Someday.
Comfort is a stance of avoidance rather than the pursuit of excellence.
If you avoid your truthful emotions and pain you will implode and contract into a diminished and feeble state.
You cannot avoid what you fear because what you fear is inside of you.
Avoidance is paying forward that which I would be much wiser to pay off.
People spend entire lifetimes trying to avoid the things that have already happened.
Most of us will do anything to avoid facing ourselves
Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than exposure.
When our purpose becomes avoidance, our life becomes a void.
Avoidance of experiences is a fixation and it binds you to the world, it binds you to the personal self.
Avoiding problems you need to face is avoiding the life you need to live.
You cannot find peace by avoiding life.

There is no pain equal to that which two lovers can inflict on one another. This should be made clear to all who contemplate such a union. The avoidance of this pain is the beginning of wisdom, for it is strong enough to contaminate the rest of our lives.
Avoid those who seek friends in order to maintain a certain social status or to open doors they would not otherwise be able to approach.
Avoidance is a wonderful therapy
All work is the avoidance of harder work.
Avoid being brainwashed or controlled by the opinions or attitudes of others.
The most common emotional defense is avoidance (an ineffective coping skill for any stressor) as expressed through denial (e.g., "That wasn't really bad, I barely remember it").
Well, it is true. Sometimes avoiding something can give it more and more meaning rather than less and less.
Conflict avoidance often causes greater conflict.
But avoidance allows you to believe that you're making all kinds of strides when you're not.
Often life is a frantic avoidance of the truth.
Avoidance of sin is lighter than the pain of remorse.
Avoidance doesn’t solve anything; it merely serves as a temporary salve.
Choosing to avoid uncomfortable feelings offers immediate short-term relief, but avoidance can lead to long-term consequences.
Avoidance has never been a great tactic in solving any problem. For most situations in life, not addressing what's going on only makes matters worse.
